page.title: 04THE TREFUSIS FAMILY:cont.
page.content:
Today on the farm there are fewer men and more machines,there are bigger herds of cattle and no sheep.The house has 6 rooms on the first floor,6 on the second floor and 6 more on the top floor for the servants.The house was converted to mains electricity in 1953,this was used mainly for lighting purposes.The familys dirty clothes was sent to the laundry,where the whole lot was cleaned for 10 shillings.
Tregew farm is part of the estate and it is let to the Laity family,who have had it for 4 years,they have all the barton, which was a park, and they keep a few bullocks and some sheep.
